Detailed Description

Classe repr√©sentant une carte de feature (double) attachee a un maillage.

Elle sera caracterisee par ses valeurs extreme et un tableau de donnees.

void Map::expand ( int  _min = -50,
int  _max = 50 
)

Dynamic expansion of the map to a new set of range.

Expands dynamically the map between two given values.

Parameters:
_min : Lowest value we want for the new map. Set to -50 by default.
_max : Highest value we want for the new map. Set to 50 by default.
Returns:
(void)

int Map::load ( char *  _path  ) 

Loads a map from a file and expand it.

Loads a map from a file AND expand this map between -50 to 50. A map stored in a file is stored as follw : For each vertex of the mesh, one value is printed in the file. So, usually there is one value per line in the file but the end-line-caracter can be suppressed and the values all printed in a single line. The map files should not content any comments.

Parameters:
_path : path to the file where the map is stored.
Returns:
(int) Returns 1 if the operation succeded, -1 else.

Returns:
(int) Returns 1 if the operation succeded, -1 else.

void Map::segment ( int  _n = 10  ) 

Segments the map based on a value criteria.

Segments the map in n classes based on a value criteria : Each vertex value will be set to its class number. The class numbers are set according to the minimum and maximum value of the map and also the number of class we want to create : If the map values range is [0, 100] and we want to create 10 classes, then the vertex which value is 34 will be set to 30 and the vertex which value is 77 will be set to 70

Parameters:
_n : number of classes we want to create in the map. Is set to 10 by default.
Returns:
(void)
